description: From Latin encaenia, from Ancient Greek (τὰ) ἐγκαίνια ((tà) enkaínia, “dedication festival”), from ἐν (en, “in”) + καινός (kainós, “new”).

entries.meaning: A festival held to mark the anniversary of the dedication of a church or temple; (especially), of the Temple at Jerusalem.
The annual commemoration service of founders and benefactors of Oxford University.
examples: I am but just returned from two great shews that have been exhibited lately the review at Portsmouth and the encenia at Oxford.
